title: @Riot, where is the "Post release support" you wanted to provide for Mordekaiser?
body:
Seriously, this rework's got a million flaws worth tackling in order to please everyone and yet we don't even get any response to our concerns coming with the same argument over and over and over and over again. "It's too early to judge Mordekaiser." No it's not, there are some pretty obvious flaws you'll be able to fix in a quick brainstorming session and please the loyal Mordekaiser mains and the newcomers learning the ropes of the Master of Metal. *Couch* Harvester of Sorrow needs some changes *cough*
Showing us you care would actually be enough for me to shut up and cease putting up a Mordekaiser thread every day ^^''

Let's be honest though. Morde-post release discussion from Reds has most definitely fallen off the boards compared to how much talk was going on before. It is *very* clear that the Red claims regarding Morde's solo lane capabilities were laughably wrong and something should really be said to address those issues.
Because most "discussion" was one sided. It was everyone complain and scream while the reds try to explain themselves.

Really because there were hundreds of creative posts that got ignored which sent people into a fury then back into a constitutive rant.

Hell even Stonewall made it known about how much he didn't like the new Morde, making RIP video for the old one.

No, his video was about top lane Mordekaiser dieing, not his distaste for the new one. (this sounds stupid, but he didn't hate on the new one, just the idea of Mordekaiser not being a top laner)

He hasn't shared much on what he thinks of current Mordekaiser in depth outside of missing his go to top lane champion.

And it's REALLY hard to find the gem of discussion posts when you are being bombarded with shit posts, at that point no one should be surprised the certainlyT avoided discussion.
Has CertainlyT ever been a part of a discussion? He's one of the few I can't recall being here.
Why would you come here with the reputation he has?

To hopefully change the reputation he has, or at the very least add context to why he designs the way that he does. He'd probably improve as a designer if fans talked about what we like and dislike about his champions.

He used to be part of discussions on the old boards, but most of his posts (when they were actually about the game, which was rare) could be summed up in "I'm a designer, and you're not. That means I know what I'm doing, thanks".

It sounds harsh, but that's how it was always interpreted. He does not handle criticism well and tends to believe that his designs were perfectly fine and it was merely a numbers issue whenever he inevitably let something bonkers out of its cage.
He made one thread on the PBE boards and that was it.

Its in the past and we are moving forward

You can view it as such, but majority of feedback was whines and complains, mass downvotes, and few people actually trying to discuss.

Anyone who dare agree with Riot or actually god forbid like the changes is downvoted to hell, and any Riot member not giving vague hope that maybe things will get better for the unhappy players was also downvoted to hell.

Whether or not the replies they got might contain discussion this is not a relaxed environment for them to be discussing anything regarding most changes.

The majority of feedback came after communication broke down.  Doesn't take a genius to read the morde pbe time stamp for certainlyT.   All he had to do was give a few reasons for his changes and show they were healthy for the champ and that would have went a long way.

I'm mostly just curious if you guys think it's possible to buff up solo lane Mordekaiser without making bot Morde too strong.

Do you guys still feel comfortable with the decision to removing his W from solo lane and the fact that right now Mordekaiser's "just" needs to hit his 3rd Q to deal the same damage he dealt with a full combo pre-rework?

I see major fallacies in this kind of damage shift because it's even more feast or famine.

Please don't try to force any sort of meta with more changes, I find being able to only play him bot extremely frustrating to play as, and from what I've come to expect, most people find it extremely frustrating to play against him and a good Leona at his side 

the biggest appeal to Mordekaiser was that he could do a lot of things with success. You've made him more flexible than he already was build-wise (which is one of the things I think you guys got right), but his dependence on needing a teammate nearby to access an important aspect of his damage is just really frustrating and warping as an experience. 

Do you have plans to make him more satisfying when he's alone and possibly less oppressive when near an ally? I think he has potential to be the first every-lane champion with actual success ( jungle/bot Mord were good before now, but still), he just needs a little fine-tuning on his numbers and usability

I want you to know that Mordekaiser is in fantastic shape. Except for his Q. That bad boy can easily destroy turrets and champions after 3 consecutive hits. Get a slow item and your set. (They can't get away, because even flashes don't stop his E.)

People love to abuse things that are powerful and his Q is one of them. Able to give bonus damage for each attack, the total damage is 260 + 360% AD + 260% AP in bonus damage (unlike most other three hit spells). True it costs health (that bonus health can over look) and has a cool down but it makes it even scarier to get close.

Now, not that I don't like his new passive (it is fantastic and makes his tank that more better) but if he is going duo one of his abilities needs to go back to its original and that's his passive or his W. Why his W? When in duo (especially when with a healer) it makes him harder to kill since he builds a healing item and has this spell (and can be healed by the support). His W honestly should be a one cast spell. Cast on one person to give bonus MS and a small heal (more heal if near enemies and way more heal if it hits a champion) for and after 3 seconds. Or it can still give to both but has a longer cool down to stop the constant heals. (Or just revert it.)

I would love for some of the damage from his Q to go to his E. I'd love for this spell to be better, especially in late, dealing more damage.

I love Mordekaiser, and tried playing him more and more before the update and after the update, I just feel that he may get very OP as I have found that he can still go in mid and win (not to mention top).
